word: H6117 - עָקַב - ʻâqab - aw-kab' - Take by the heel

sections.paragraph: சுருக்க விளக்கம் / Short Definition: Take by the heel
வினைச்சொல் - குதிகாலைப்பிடி, மோசம்பண்ணு, மோசம் போ, தவிர்
to supplant, to circumvent, to take by the heel, to follow at the heel, to assail insidiously, to overreach
a) (Qal) to supplant, to overreach, to attack at the heel

ஆங்கில மூலம் / Original in English: A primitive root; properly to swell out or up; used only as denominative from H6119, to seize by the heel; figuratively to circumvent (as if tripping up the heels); also to restrain (as if holding by the heel): - take by the heel, stay, supplant, X utterly.
Cognate: H3290, H3291, H6117, H6118, H6119, H6120, H6121, H6122, H6126
